summary.long: Matthew is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the Son of David, the Son of Abraham:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham begot Isaac, Isaac begot Jacob, and Jacob begot Judah and his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah begot Perez and Zerah by Tamar, Perez begot Hezron, and Hezron begot Ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ram begot Amminadab, Amminadab begot Nahshon, and Nahshon begot Salmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salmon begot Boaz by Rahab, Boaz begot Obed by Ruth, Obed begot Jesse,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and Jesse begot David the king.
David the king begot Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon begot Rehoboam, Rehoboam begot Abijah, and Abijah begot Asa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asa begot Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat begot Joram, and Joram begot Uzziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Uzziah begot Jotham, Jotham begot Ahaz, and Ahaz begot Hezekiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hezekiah begot Manasseh, Manasseh begot Amon, and Amon begot Josiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Josiah begot Jeconiah and his brothers about the time they were carried away to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they were brought to Babylon, Jeconiah begot Shealtiel, and Shealtiel begot Zerubbabel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zerubbabel begot Abiud, Abiud begot Eliakim, and Eliakim begot Azor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azor begot Zadok, Zadok begot Achim, and Achim begot Eliud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliud begot Eleazar, Eleazar begot Matthan, and Matthan begot Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob begot Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus who is called Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations, from David until the captivity in Babylon are fourteen generations, and from the captivity in Babylon until the Christ are fourteen generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was as follows: After His mother Mary was betrothed to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child of the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph her husband, being a just man, and not wanting to make her a public example, was minded to put her away secretly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while he thought about these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, “Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take to you Mary your wife, for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she will bring forth a Son, and you shall call His name Jesus, for He will save His people from their sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all this was done that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the virgin shall be with child, and bear a Son, and they shall call His name Immanuel,” which is translated, “God with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph, being aroused from sleep, did as the angel of the Lord commanded him and took to him his wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and did not know her till she had brought forth her firstborn Son. And he called His name Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, behold, wise men from the East came to Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Where is He who has been born King of the Jews? For we have seen His star in the East and have come to worship Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod the king heard this, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he inquired of them where the Christ was to be born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, for thus it is written by the prophet:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘But you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah,
Are not the least among the rulers of Judah;
For out of you shall come a Ruler
Who will shepherd My people Israel.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod, when he had secretly called the wise men, determined from them what time the star appeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent them to Bethlehem and said, “Go and search carefully for the young Child, and when you have found Him, bring back word to me, that I may come and worship Him also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard the king, they departed; and behold, the star which they had seen in the East went before them, till it came and stood over where the young Child was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had come into the house, they saw the young Child with Mary His mother, and fell down and worshiped Him. And when they had opened their treasures, they presented gifts to Him: gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, being divinely warned in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed for their own country another way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they had departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, “Arise, take the young Child and His mother, flee to Egypt, and stay there until I bring you word; for Herod will seek the young Child to destroy Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he arose, he took the young Child and His mother by night and departed for Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and was there until the death of Herod, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying, “Out of Egypt I called My Son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod, when he saw that he was deceived by the wise men, was exceedingly angry; and he sent forth and put to death all the male children who were in Bethlehem and in all its districts, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had determined from the wise men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then was fulfilled what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A voice was heard in Ramah,
Lamentation, weeping, and great mourning,
Rachel weeping for her children,
Refusing to be comforted,
Because they are no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Arise, take the young Child and His mother, and go to the land of Israel, for those who sought the young Child’s life are dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he arose, took the young Child and His mother, and came into the land of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea instead of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. And being warned by God in a dream, he turned aside into the region of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets, “He shall be called a Nazarene.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days John the Baptist came preaching in the wilderness of Judea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is he who was spoken of by the prophet Isaiah, saying:
“The voice of one crying in the wilderness:
‘Prepare the way of the Lord;
Make His paths straight.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now John himself was clothed in camel’s hair, with a leather belt around his waist; and his food was locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jerusalem, all Judea, and all the region around the Jordan went out to him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said to them, “Brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore bear fruits worthy of repentance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and do not think to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I say to you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even now the ax is laid to the root of the trees. Therefore every tree which does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance, but He who is coming after me is mightier than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His winnowing fan is in His hand, and He will thoroughly clean out His threshing floor, and gather His wheat into the barn; but He will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came from Galilee to John at the Jordan to be baptized by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And John tried to prevent Him, saying, “I need to be baptized by You, and are You coming to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered and said to him, “Permit it to be so now, for thus it is fitting for us to fulfill all righteousness.” Then he allowed Him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When He had been baptized, Jesus came up immediately from the water; and behold, the heavens were opened to Him, and He saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and alighting upon Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly a voice came from heaven, saying, “This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had fasted forty days and forty nights, afterward He was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the tempter came to Him, he said, “If You are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He answered and said, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds from the mouth of God.’ ”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil took Him up into the holy city, set Him on the pinnacle of the temple,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down. For it is written:
‘He shall give His angels charge over you,’
and,
‘In their hands they shall bear you up,
Lest you dash your foot against a stone.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “It is written again, ‘You shall not tempt the Lord your God.’ ”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Again, the devil took Him up on an exceedingly high mountain, and showed Him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to Him, “All these things I will give You if You will fall down and worship me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Away with you, Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and Him only you shall serve.’ ”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil left Him, and behold, angels came and ministered to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus heard that John had been put in prison, He departed to Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And leaving Nazareth, He came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the regions of Zebulun and Naphtali,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali,
By the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan,
Galilee of the Gentiles:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people who sat in darkness have seen a great light,
And upon those who sat in the region and shadow of death
Light has dawned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time Jesus began to preach and to say, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus, walking by the Sea of Galilee, saw two brothers, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea; for they were fishermen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “Follow Me, and I will make you fishers of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They immediately left their nets and followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Going on from there, He saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets. He called them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and immediately they left the boat and their father, and followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all kinds of sickness and all kinds of disease among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then His fame went throughout all Syria; and they brought to Him all sick people who were afflicted with various diseases and torments, and those who were demon-possessed, epileptics, and paralytics; and He healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Great multitudes followed Him—from Galilee, and from Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and beyond the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seeing the multitudes, He went up on a mountain, and when He was seated His disciples came to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He opened His mouth and taught them, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed are the poor in spirit,
For theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are those who mourn,
For they shall be comforted.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are the meek,
For they shall inherit the earth.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness,
For they shall be filled.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are the merciful,
For they shall obtain mercy.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are the pure in heart,
For they shall see God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are the peacemakers,
For they shall be called sons of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness’ sake,
For theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Blessed are you when they revile and persecute you, and say all kinds of evil against you falsely for My sake.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Rejoice and be exceedingly glad, for great is your reward in heaven, for so they persecuted the prophets who were before you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You are the salt of the earth; but if the salt loses its flavor, how shall it be seasoned? It is then good for nothing but to be thrown out and trampled underfoot by men.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You are the light of the world. A city that is set on a hill cannot be hidden.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nor do they light a lamp and put it under a basket, but on a lampstand, and it gives light to all who are in the house.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do not think that I came to destroy the Law or the Prophets. I did not come to destroy but to fulfill.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For assuredly, I say to you, till heaven and earth pass away, one jot or one tittle will by no means pass from the law till all is fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whoever therefore breaks one of the least of these commandments, and teaches men so, shall be called least in the kingdom of heaven; but whoever does and teaches them, he shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For I say to you, that unless your righteousness exceeds the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, you will by no means enter the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said to those of old, ‘You shall not murder, and whoever murders will be in danger of the judgment.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you that whoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment. And whoever says to his brother, ‘Raca!’ shall be in danger of the council. But whoever says, ‘You fool!’ shall be in danger of hell fire.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore if you bring your gift to the altar, and there remember that your brother has something against you,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: leave your gift there before the altar, and go your way. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Agree with your adversary quickly, while you are on the way with him, lest your adversary deliver you to the judge, the judge hand you over to the officer, and you be thrown into prison.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Assuredly, I say to you, you will by no means get out of there till you have paid the last penny.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said to those of old, ‘You shall not commit adultery.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you that whoever looks at a woman to lust for her has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If your right eye causes you to sin, pluck it out and cast it from you; for it is more profitable for you that one of your members perish, than for your whole body to be cast into hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and cast it from you; for it is more profitable for you that one of your members perish, than for your whole body to be cast into hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Furthermore it has been said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife, let him give her a certificate of divorce.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you that whoever divorces his wife for any reason except sexual immorality causes her to commit adultery; and whoever marries a woman who is divorced commits adultery.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Again you have heard that it was said to those of old, ‘You shall not swear falsely, but shall perform your oaths to the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you, do not swear at all: neither by heaven, for it is God’s throne;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: nor by the earth, for it is His footstool; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nor shall you swear by your head, because you cannot make one hair white or black.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But let your ‘Yes’ be ‘Yes,’ and your ‘No,’ ‘No.’ For whatever is more than these is from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I tell you not to resist an evil person. But whoever slaps you on your right cheek, turn the other to him also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If anyone wants to sue you and take away your tunic, let him have your cloak also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whoever compels you to go one mile, go with him two.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give to him who asks you, and from him who wants to borrow from you do not turn away.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I say to you, love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who spitefully use you and persecute you,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: that you may be sons of your Father in heaven; for He makes His sun rise on the evil and on the good, and sends rain on the just and on the unjust.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For if you love those who love you, what reward have you? Do not even the tax collectors do the same?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And if you greet your brethren only, what do you do more than others? Do not even the tax collectors do so?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore you shall be perfect, just as your Father in heaven is perfect.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Take heed that you do not do your charitable deeds before men, to be seen by them. Otherwise you have no reward from your Father in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore, when you do a charitable deed, do not sound a trumpet before you as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory from men. Assuredly, I say to you, they have their reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when you do a charitable deed, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: that your charitable deed may be in secret; and your Father who sees in secret will Himself reward you openly.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “And when you pray, you shall not be like the hypocrites. For they love to pray standing in the synagogues and on the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men. Assuredly, I say to you, they have their reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But you, when you pray, go into your room, and when you have shut your door, pray to your Father who is in the secret place; and your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when you pray, do not use vain repetitions as the heathen do. For they think that they will be heard for their many words.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Therefore do not be like them. For your Father knows the things you have need of before you ask Him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
In this manner, therefore, pray:
Our Father in heaven,
Hallowed be Your name.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Your kingdom come.
Your will be done
On earth as it is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give us this day our daily bread.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
And forgive us our debts,
As we forgive our debtors.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
And do not lead us into temptation,
But deliver us from the evil one.
For Yours is the kingdom and the power and the glory forever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if you do not forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Moreover, when you fast, do not be like the hypocrites, with a sad countenance. For they disfigure their faces that they may appear to men to be fasting. Assuredly, I say to you, they have their reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But you, when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: so that you do not appear to men to be fasting, but to your Father who is in the secret place; and your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do not lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust destroy and where thieves break in and steal;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust destroys and where thieves do not break in and steal.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “The lamp of the body is the eye. If therefore your eye is good, your whole body will be full of light.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if your eye is bad, your whole body will be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in you is darkness, how great is that darkness!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “No one can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will be loyal to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and mammon.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Therefore I say to you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat or what you will drink; nor about your body, what you will put on. Is not life more than food and the body more than clothing?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Look at the birds of the air, for they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not of more value than they?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Which of you by worrying can add one cubit to his stature?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “So why do you worry about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and yet I say to you that even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today is, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, will He not much more clothe you, O you of little faith?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Therefore do not worry, saying, ‘What shall we eat?’ or ‘What shall we drink?’ or ‘What shall we wear?’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For after all these things the Gentiles seek. For your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things shall be added to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about its own things. Sufficient for the day is its own trouble.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Judge not, that you be not judged.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For with what judgment you judge, you will be judged; and with the measure you use, it will be measured back to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And why do you look at the speck in your brother’s eye, but do not consider the plank in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or how can you say to your brother, ‘Let me remove the speck from your eye’; and look, a plank is in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Hypocrite! First remove the plank from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do not give what is holy to the dogs; nor cast your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn and tear you in pieces.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For everyone who asks receives, and he who seeks finds, and to him who knocks it will be opened.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or what man is there among you who, if his son asks for bread, will give him a stone?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or if he asks for a fish, will he give him a serpent?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask Him!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore, whatever you want men to do to you, do also to them, for this is the Law and the Prophets.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Enter by the narrow gate; for wide is the gate and broad is the way that leads to destruction, and there are many who go in by it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Because narrow is the gate and difficult is the way which leads to life, and there are few who find it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravenous wolves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You will know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes from thornbushes or figs from thistles?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Even so, every good tree bears good fruit, but a bad tree bears bad fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor can a bad tree bear good fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore by their fruits you will know them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Not everyone who says to Me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ shall enter the kingdom of heaven, but he who does the will of My Father in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Many will say to Me in that day, ‘Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in Your name, cast out demons in Your name, and done many wonders in Your name?’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And then I will declare to them, ‘I never knew you; depart from Me, you who practice lawlessness!’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Therefore whoever hears these sayings of Mine, and does them, I will liken him to a wise man who built his house on the rock:
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and the rain descended, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house; and it did not fall, for it was founded on the rock.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “But everyone who hears these sayings of Mine, and does not do them, will be like a foolish man who built his house on the sand:
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and the rain descended, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house; and it fell. And great was its fall.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And so it was, when Jesus had ended these sayings, that the people were astonished at His teaching,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for He taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had come down from the mountain, great multitudes followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a leper came and worshiped Him, saying, “Lord, if You are willing, You can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus put out His hand and touched him, saying, “I am willing; be cleansed.” Immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “See that you tell no one; but go your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now when Jesus had entered Capernaum, a centurion came to Him, pleading with Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Lord, my servant is lying at home paralyzed, dreadfully tormented.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “I will come and heal him.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The centurion answered and said, “Lord, I am not worthy that You should come under my roof. But only speak a word, and my servant will be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I also am a man under authority, having soldiers under me. And I say to this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard it, He marveled, and said to those who followed, “Assuredly, I say to you, I have not found such great faith, not even in Israel!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And I say to you that many will come from east and west, and sit down with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the sons of the kingdom will be cast out into outer darkness. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the centurion, “Go your way; and as you have believed, so let it be done for you.” And his servant was healed that same hour.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now when Jesus had come into Peter’s house, He saw his wife’s mother lying sick with a fever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He touched her hand, and the fever left her. And she arose and served them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening had come, they brought to Him many who were demon-possessed. And He cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were sick,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying:
“He Himself took our infirmities
And bore our sicknesses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus saw great multitudes about Him, He gave a command to depart to the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a certain scribe came and said to Him, “Teacher, I will follow You wherever You go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then another of His disciples said to Him, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Follow Me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now when He got into a boat, His disciples followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly a great tempest arose on the sea, so that the boat was covered with the waves. But He was asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then His disciples came to Him and awoke Him, saying, “Lord, save us! We are perishing!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said to them, “Why are you fearful, O you of little faith?” Then He arose and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a great calm.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So the men marveled, saying, “Who can this be, that even the winds and the sea obey Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had come to the other side, to the country of the Gergesenes, there met Him two demon-possessed men, coming out of the tombs, exceedingly fierce, so that no one could pass that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly they cried out, saying, “What have we to do with You, Jesus, You Son of God? Have You come here to torment us before the time?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a good way off from them there was a herd of many swine feeding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the demons begged Him, saying, “If You cast us out, permit us to go away into the herd of swine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “Go.” So when they had come out, they went into the herd of swine. And suddenly the whole herd of swine ran violently down the steep place into the sea, and perished in the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those who kept them fled; and they went away into the city and told everything, including what had happened to the demon-possessed men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus. And when they saw Him, they begged Him to depart from their region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He got into a boat, crossed over, and came to His own city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then behold, they brought to Him a paralytic lying on a bed. When Jesus saw their faith, He said to the paralytic, “Son, be of good cheer; your sins are forgiven you.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And at once some of the scribes said within themselves, “This Man blasphemes!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said, “Why do you think evil in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Arise and walk’?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins”—then He said to the paralytic, “Arise, take up your bed, and go to your house.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he arose and departed to his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the multitudes saw it, they marveled and glorified God, who had given such power to men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus passed on from there, He saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax office. And He said to him, “Follow Me.” So he arose and followed Him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now it happened, as Jesus sat at the table in the house, that behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Him and His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said to His disciples, “Why does your Teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard that, He said to them, “Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But go and learn what this means: ‘I desire mercy and not sacrifice.’ For I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners, to repentance.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the disciples of John came to Him, saying, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but Your disciples do not fast?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “Can the friends of the bridegroom mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: No one puts a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment; for the patch pulls away from the garment, and the tear is made worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor do they put new wine into old wineskins, or else the wineskins break, the wine is spilled, and the wineskins are ruined. But they put new wine into new wineskins, and both are preserved.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: While He spoke these things to them, behold, a ruler came and worshiped Him, saying, “My daughter has just died, but come and lay Your hand on her and she will live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus arose and followed him, and so did His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly, a woman who had a flow of blood for twelve years came from behind and touched the hem of His garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For she said to herself, “If only I may touch His garment, I shall be made well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus turned around, and when He saw her He said, “Be of good cheer, daughter; your faith has made you well.” And the woman was made well from that hour.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus came into the ruler’s house, and saw the flute players and the noisy crowd wailing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Make room, for the girl is not dead, but sleeping.” And they ridiculed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the crowd was put outside, He went in and took her by the hand, and the girl arose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the report of this went out into all that land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus departed from there, two blind men followed Him, crying out and saying, “Son of David, have mercy on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And when He had come into the house, the blind men came to Him. And Jesus said to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?”
They said to Him, “Yes, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then He touched their eyes, saying, “According to your faith let it be to you.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And their eyes were opened. And Jesus sternly warned them, saying, “See that no one knows it.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when they had departed, they spread the news about Him in all that country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went out, behold, they brought to Him a man, mute and demon-possessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the demon was cast out, the mute spoke. And the multitudes marveled, saying, “It was never seen like this in Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees said, “He casts out demons by the ruler of the demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when He saw the multitudes, He was moved with compassion for them, because they were weary and scattered, like sheep having no shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to His disciples, “The harvest truly is plentiful, but the laborers are few.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore pray the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into His harvest.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when He had called His twelve disciples to Him, He gave them power over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all kinds of sickness and all kinds of disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these: first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon the Cananite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These twelve Jesus sent out and commanded them, saying: “Do not go into the way of the Gentiles, and do not enter a city of the Samaritans.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And as you go, preach, saying, ‘The kingdom of heaven is at hand.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, cast out demons. Freely you have received, freely give.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Provide neither gold nor silver nor copper in your money belts,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: nor bag for your journey, nor two tunics, nor sandals, nor staffs; for a worker is worthy of his food.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Now whatever city or town you enter, inquire who in it is worthy, and stay there till you go out.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when you go into a household, greet it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If the household is worthy, let your peace come upon it. But if it is not worthy, let your peace return to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whoever will not receive you nor hear your words, when you depart from that house or city, shake off the dust from your feet.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Assuredly, I say to you, it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Behold, I send you out as sheep in the midst of wolves. Therefore be wise as serpents and harmless as doves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But beware of men, for they will deliver you up to councils and scourge you in their synagogues.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You will be brought before governors and kings for My sake, as a testimony to them and to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when they deliver you up, do not worry about how or what you should speak. For it will be given to you in that hour what you should speak;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: for it is not you who speak, but the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Now brother will deliver up brother to death, and a father his child; and children will rise up against parents and cause them to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And you will be hated by all for My name’s sake. But he who endures to the end will be saved.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When they persecute you in this city, flee to another. For assuredly, I say to you, you will not have gone through the cities of Israel before the Son of Man comes.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “A disciple is not above his teacher, nor a servant above his master.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: It is enough for a disciple that he be like his teacher, and a servant like his master. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more will they call those of his household!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore do not fear them. For there is nothing covered that will not be revealed, and hidden that will not be known.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Whatever I tell you in the dark, speak in the light; and what you hear in the ear, preach on the housetops.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And do not fear those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul. But rather fear Him who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Are not two sparrows sold for a copper coin? And not one of them falls to the ground apart from your Father’s will.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Do not fear therefore; you are of more value than many sparrows.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Therefore whoever confesses Me before men, him I will also confess before My Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But whoever denies Me before men, him I will also deny before My Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Do not think that I came to bring peace on earth. I did not come to bring peace but a sword.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For I have come to ‘set a man against his father, a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law’;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and ‘a man’s enemies will be those of his own household.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who loves father or mother more than Me is not worthy of Me. And he who loves son or daughter more than Me is not worthy of Me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he who does not take his cross and follow after Me is not worthy of Me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who finds his life will lose it, and he who loses his life for My sake will find it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “He who receives you receives Me, and he who receives Me receives Him who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet’s reward. And he who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man’s reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And whoever gives one of these little ones only a cup of cold water in the name of a disciple, assuredly, I say to you, he shall by no means lose his reward.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now it came to pass, when Jesus finished commanding His twelve disciples, that He departed from there to teach and to preach in their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when John had heard in prison about the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to Him, “Are You the Coming One, or do we look for another?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them, “Go and tell John the things which you hear and see:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blind see and the lame walk; the lepers are cleansed and the deaf hear; the dead are raised up and the poor have the gospel preached to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And blessed is he who is not offended because of Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they departed, Jesus began to say to the multitudes concerning John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in soft garments? Indeed, those who wear soft clothing are in kings’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I say to you, and more than a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is he of whom it is written:
‘Behold, I send My messenger before Your face,
Who will prepare Your way before You.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Assuredly, I say to you, among those born of women there has not risen one greater than John the Baptist; but he who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven suffers violence, and the violent take it by force.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you are willing to receive it, he is Elijah who is to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who has ears to hear, let him hear!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But to what shall I liken this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces and calling to their companions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and saying:
‘We played the flute for you,
And you did not dance;
We mourned to you,
And you did not lament.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Look, a glutton and a winebibber, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ But wisdom is justified by her children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He began to rebuke the cities in which most of His mighty works had been done, because they did not repent:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works which were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say to you, it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the day of judgment than for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, will be brought down to Hades; for if the mighty works which were done in you had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say to you that it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment than for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus answered and said, “I thank You, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that You have hidden these things from the wise and prudent and have revealed them to babes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so, Father, for so it seemed good in Your sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things have been delivered to Me by My Father, and no one knows the Son except the Father. Nor does anyone know the Father except the Son, and the one to whom the Son wills to reveal Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come to Me, all you who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take My yoke upon you and learn from Me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For My yoke is easy and My burden is light.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus went through the grainfields on the Sabbath. And His disciples were hungry, and began to pluck heads of grain and to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said to Him, “Look, Your disciples are doing what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said to them, “Have you not read what David did when he was hungry, he and those who were with him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how he entered the house of God and ate the showbread which was not lawful for him to eat, nor for those who were with him, but only for the priests?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or have you not read in the law that on the Sabbath the priests in the temple profane the Sabbath, and are blameless?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet I say to you that in this place there is One greater than the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you had known what this means, ‘I desire mercy and not sacrifice,’ you would not have condemned the guiltless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when He had departed from there, He went into their synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a man who had a withered hand. And they asked Him, saying, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”—that they might accuse Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “What man is there among you who has one sheep, and if it falls into a pit on the Sabbath, will not lay hold of it and lift it out?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of how much more value then is a man than a sheep? Therefore it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” And he stretched it out, and it was restored as whole as the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees went out and plotted against Him, how they might destroy Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus knew it, He withdrew from there. And great multitudes followed Him, and He healed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet He warned them not to make Him known,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold! My Servant whom I have chosen,
My Beloved in whom My soul is well pleased!
I will put My Spirit upon Him,
And He will declare justice to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not quarrel nor cry out,
Nor will anyone hear His voice in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: And in His name Gentiles will trust.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one was brought to Him who was demon-possessed, blind and mute; and He healed him, so that the blind and mute man both spoke and saw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the multitudes were amazed and said, “Could this be the Son of David?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Pharisees heard it they said, “This fellow does not cast out demons except by Beelzebub, the ruler of the demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus knew their thoughts, and said to them: “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation, and every city or house divided against itself will not stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then will his kingdom stand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I cast out demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they shall be your judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I cast out demons by the Spirit of God, surely the kingdom of God has come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or how can one enter a strong man’s house and plunder his goods, unless he first binds the strong man? And then he will plunder his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who is not with Me is against Me, and he who does not gather with Me scatters abroad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore I say to you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him; but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven him, either in this age or in the age to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Either make the tree good and its fruit good, or else make the tree bad and its fruit bad; for a tree is known by its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brood of vipers! How can you, being evil, speak good things? For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings forth good things, and an evil man out of the evil treasure brings forth evil things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say to you that for every idle word men may speak, they will give account of it in the day of judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the scribes and Pharisees answered, saying, “Teacher, we want to see a sign from You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He answered and said to them, “An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and no sign will be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of the great fish, so will the Son of Man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Nineveh will rise up in the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and indeed a greater than Jonah is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with this generation and condemn it, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and indeed a greater than Solomon is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When an unclean spirit goes out of a man, he goes through dry places, seeking rest, and finds none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came.’ And when he comes, he finds it empty, swept, and put in order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he goes and takes with him seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter and dwell there; and the last state of that man is worse than the first. So shall it also be with this wicked generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While He was still talking to the multitudes, behold, His mother and brothers stood outside, seeking to speak with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one said to Him, “Look, Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside, seeking to speak with You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He answered and said to the one who told Him, “Who is My mother and who are My brothers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He stretched out His hand toward His disciples and said, “Here are My mother and My brothers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever does the will of My Father in heaven is My brother and sister and mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the same day Jesus went out of the house and sat by the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And great multitudes were gathered together to Him, so that He got into a boat and sat; and the whole multitude stood on the shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He spoke many things to them in parables, saying: “Behold, a sower went out to sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he sowed, some seed fell by the wayside; and the birds came and devoured them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some fell on stony places, where they did not have much earth; and they immediately sprang up because they had no depth of earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the sun was up they were scorched, and because they had no root they withered away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns sprang up and choked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But others fell on good ground and yielded a crop: some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples came and said to Him, “Why do You speak to them in parables?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said to them, “Because it has been given to you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it has not been given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever has, to him more will be given, and he will have abundance; but whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I speak to them in parables, because seeing they do not see, and hearing they do not hear, nor do they understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the hearts of this people have grown dull.
Their ears are hard of hearing,
And their eyes they have closed,
Lest they should see with their eyes and hear with their ears,
Lest they should understand with their hearts and turn,
So that I should heal them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But blessed are your eyes for they see, and your ears for they hear;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for assuredly, I say to you that many prophets and righteous men desired to see what you see, and did not see it, and to hear what you hear, and did not hear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore hear the parable of the sower:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When anyone hears the word of the kingdom, and does not understand it, then the wicked one comes and snatches away what was sown in his heart. This is he who received seed by the wayside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who received the seed on stony places, this is he who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet he has no root in himself, but endures only for a while. For when tribulation or persecution arises because of the word, immediately he stumbles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he who received seed among the thorns is he who hears the word, and the cares of this world and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word, and he becomes unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who received seed on the good ground is he who hears the word and understands it, who indeed bears fruit and produces: some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another parable He put forth to them, saying: “The kingdom of heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat and went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the grain had sprouted and produced a crop, then the tares also appeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the servants of the owner came and said to him, ‘Sir, did you not sow good seed in your field? How then does it have tares?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, ‘An enemy has done this.’ The servants said to him, ‘Do you want us then to go and gather them up?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, ‘No, lest while you gather up the tares you also uproot the wheat with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let both grow together until the harvest, and at the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, “First gather together the tares and bind them in bundles to burn them, but gather the wheat into my barn.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another parable He put forth to them, saying: “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed, which a man took and sowed in his field,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which indeed is the least of all the seeds; but when it is grown it is greater than the herbs and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and nest in its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another parable He spoke to them: “The kingdom of heaven is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal till it was all leavened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these things Jesus spoke to the multitude in parables; and without a parable He did not speak to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus sent the multitude away and went into the house. And His disciples came to Him, saying, “Explain to us the parable of the tares of the field.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said to them: “He who sows the good seed is the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The field is the world, the good seeds are the sons of the kingdom, but the tares are the sons of the wicked one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The enemy who sowed them is the devil, the harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are the angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore as the tares are gathered and burned in the fire, so it will be at the end of this age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man will send out His angels, and they will gather out of His kingdom all things that offend, and those who practice lawlessness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the righteous will shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. He who has ears to hear, let him hear!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field, which a man found and hid; and for joy over it he goes and sells all that he has and buys that field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant seeking beautiful pearls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had and bought it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a dragnet that was cast into the sea and gathered some of every kind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which, when it was full, they drew to shore; and they sat down and gathered the good into vessels, but threw the bad away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it will be at the end of the age. The angels will come forth, separate the wicked from among the just,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to them, “Have you understood all these things?”
They said to Him, “Yes, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “Therefore every scribe instructed concerning the kingdom of heaven is like a householder who brings out of his treasure things new and old.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass, when Jesus had finished these parables, that He departed from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had come to His own country, He taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished and said, “Where did this Man get this wisdom and these mighty works?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is this not the carpenter’s son? Is not His mother called Mary? And His brothers James, Joses, Simon, and Judas?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And His sisters, are they not all with us? Where then did this Man get all these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they were offended at Him.
But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his own country and in his own house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now He did not do many mighty works there because of their unbelief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard the report about Jesus
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to his servants, “This is John the Baptist; he is risen from the dead, and therefore these powers are at work in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Herod had laid hold of John and bound him, and put him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because John had said to him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And although he wanted to put him to death, he feared the multitude, because they counted him as a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Herod’s birthday was celebrated, the daughter of Herodias danced before them and pleased Herod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he promised with an oath to give her whatever she might ask.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she, having been prompted by her mother, said, “Give me John the Baptist’s head here on a platter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king was sorry; nevertheless, because of the oaths and because of those who sat with him, he commanded it to be given to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he sent and had John beheaded in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his disciples came and took away the body and buried it, and went and told Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard it, He departed from there by boat to a deserted place by Himself. But when the multitudes heard it, they followed Him on foot from the cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus went out He saw a great multitude; and He was moved with compassion for them, and healed their sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was evening, His disciples came to Him, saying, “This is a deserted place, and the hour is already late. Send the multitudes away, that they may go into the villages and buy themselves food.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, “They do not need to go away. You give them something to eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to Him, “We have here only five loaves and two fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Bring them here to Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He commanded the multitudes to sit down on the grass. And He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, He blessed and broke and gave the loaves to the disciples; and the disciples gave to the multitudes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they all ate and were filled, and they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments that remained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who had eaten were about five thousand men, besides women and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately Jesus made His disciples get into the boat and go before Him to the other side, while He sent the multitudes away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had sent the multitudes away, He went up on the mountain by Himself to pray. Now when evening came, He was alone there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the boat was now in the middle of the sea, tossed by the waves, for the wind was contrary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went to them, walking on the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the disciples saw Him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, “It is a ghost!” And they cried out for fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But immediately Jesus spoke to them, saying, “Be of good cheer! It is I; do not be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter answered Him and said, “Lord, if it is You, command me to come to You on the water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He said, “Come.” And when Peter had come down out of the boat, he walked on the water to go to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he saw that the wind was boisterous, he was afraid; and beginning to sink he cried out, saying, “Lord, save me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately Jesus stretched out His hand and caught him, and said to him, “O you of little faith, why did you doubt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they got into the boat, the wind ceased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those who were in the boat came and worshiped Him, saying, “Truly You are the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had crossed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the men of that place recognized Him, they sent out into all that surrounding region, brought to Him all who were sick,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and begged Him that they might only touch the hem of His garment. And as many as touched it were made perfectly well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the scribes and Pharisees who were from Jerusalem came to Jesus, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do Your disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? For they do not wash their hands when they eat bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said to them, “Why do you also transgress the commandment of God because of your tradition?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God commanded, saying, ‘Honor your father and your mother’; and, ‘He who curses father or mother, let him be put to death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you say, ‘Whoever says to his father or mother, “Whatever profit you might have received from me is a gift to God”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he need not honor his father or mother.’ Thus you have made the commandment of God of no effect by your tradition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hypocrites! Well did Isaiah prophesy about you, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘These people draw near to Me with their mouth,
And honor Me with their lips,
But their heart is far from Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And in vain they worship Me,
Teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had called the multitude to Himself, He said to them, “Hear and understand:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not what goes into the mouth defiles a man; but what comes out of the mouth, this defiles a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then His disciples came and said to Him, “Do You know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this saying?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He answered and said, “Every plant which My heavenly Father has not planted will be uprooted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them alone. They are blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind leads the blind, both will fall into a ditch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter answered and said to Him, “Explain this parable to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said, “Are you also still without understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not yet understand that whatever enters the mouth goes into the stomach and is eliminated?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come from the heart, and they defile a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the things which defile a man, but to eat with unwashed hands does not defile a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went out from there and departed to the region of Tyre and Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a woman of Canaan came from that region and cried out to Him, saying, “Have mercy on me, O Lord, Son of David! My daughter is severely demon-possessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But He answered her not a word.
And His disciples came and urged Him, saying, “Send her away, for she cries out after us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He answered and said, “I was not sent except to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she came and worshiped Him, saying, “Lord, help me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He answered and said, “It is not good to take the children’s bread and throw it to the little dogs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said, “Yes, Lord, yet even the little dogs eat the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered and said to her, “O woman, great is your faith! Let it be to you as you desire.” And her daughter was healed from that very hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus departed from there, skirted the Sea of Galilee, and went up on the mountain and sat down there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then great multitudes came to Him, having with them the lame, blind, mute, maimed, and many others; and they laid them down at Jesus’ feet, and He healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the multitude marveled when they saw the mute speaking, the maimed made whole, the lame walking, and the blind seeing; and they glorified the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus called His disciples to Himself and said, “I have compassion on the multitude, because they have now continued with Me three days and have nothing to eat. And I do not want to send them away hungry, lest they faint on the way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then His disciples said to Him, “Where could we get enough bread in the wilderness to fill such a great multitude?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to them, “How many loaves do you have?”
And they said, “Seven, and a few little fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He took the seven loaves and the fish and gave thanks, broke them and gave them to His disciples; and the disciples gave to the multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they all ate and were filled, and they took up seven large baskets full of the fragments that were left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He sent away the multitude, got into the boat, and came to the region of Magdala.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees and Sadducees came, and testing Him asked that He would show them a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said to them, “When it is evening you say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red’;
verses.speaker: Narrator
