verses.text: and in the morning, ‘It will be foul weather today, for the sky is red and threatening.’ Hypocrites! You know how to discern the face of the sky, but you cannot discern the signs of the times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wicked and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and no sign shall be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah.” And He left them and departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when His disciples had come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the Sadducees.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, “It is because we have taken no bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, being aware of it, said to them, “O you of little faith, why do you reason among yourselves because you have brought no bread?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not yet understand, or remember the five loaves of the five thousand and how many baskets you took up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor the seven loaves of the four thousand and how many large baskets you took up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How is it you do not understand that I did not speak to you concerning bread?—but to beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they understood that He did not tell them to beware of the leaven of bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came into the region of Caesarea Philippi, He asked His disciples, saying, “Who do men say that I, the Son of Man, am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said, “Some say John the Baptist, some Elijah, and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter answered and said, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to him, “Blessed are you, Simon Bar-Jonah, for flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but My Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I also say to you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build My church, and the gates of Hades shall not prevail against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven, and whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He commanded His disciples that they should tell no one that He was Jesus the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time Jesus began to show to His disciples that He must go to Jerusalem, and suffer many things from the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised the third day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter took Him aside and began to rebuke Him, saying, “Far be it from You, Lord; this shall not happen to You!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He turned and said to Peter, “Get behind Me, Satan! You are an offense to Me, for you are not mindful of the things of God, but the things of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to His disciples, “If anyone desires to come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake will find it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what profit is it to a man if he gains the whole world, and loses his own soul? Or what will a man give in exchange for his soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man will come in the glory of His Father with His angels, and then He will reward each according to his works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Assuredly, I say to you, there are some standing here who shall not taste death till they see the Son of Man coming in His kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John his brother, led them up on a high mountain by themselves;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He was transfigured before them. His face shone like the sun, and His clothes became as white as the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, Moses and Elijah appeared to them, talking with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter answered and said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here; if You wish, let us make here three tabernacles: one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them; and suddenly a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased. Hear Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the disciples heard it, they fell on their faces and were greatly afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus came and touched them and said, “Arise, and do not be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had lifted up their eyes, they saw no one but Jesus only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as they came down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying, “Tell the vision to no one until the Son of Man is risen from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And His disciples asked Him, saying, “Why then do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them, “Indeed, Elijah is coming first and will restore all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say to you that Elijah has come already, and they did not know him but did to him whatever they wished. Likewise the Son of Man is also about to suffer at their hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples understood that He spoke to them of John the Baptist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had come to the multitude, a man came to Him, kneeling down to Him and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is an epileptic and suffers severely; for he often falls into the fire and often into the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I brought him to Your disciples, but they could not cure him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered and said, “O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him here to Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus rebuked the demon, and it came out of him; and the child was cured from that very hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately and said, “Why could we not cast it out?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them, “Because of your unbelief; for assuredly, I say to you, if you have faith as a mustard seed, you will say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move; and nothing will be impossible for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, this kind does not go out except by prayer and fasting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while they were staying in Galilee, Jesus said to them, “The Son of Man is about to be betrayed into the hands of men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will kill Him, and the third day He will be raised up.” And they were exceedingly sorrowful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had come to Capernaum, those who received the temple tax came to Peter and said, “Does your Teacher not pay the temple tax?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “Yes.”
And when he had come into the house, Jesus anticipated him, saying, “What do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth take customs or taxes, from their sons or from strangers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Peter said to Him, “From strangers.”
Jesus said to him, “Then the sons are free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, lest we offend them, go to the sea, cast in a hook, and take the fish that comes up first. And when you have opened its mouth, you will find a piece of money; take that and give it to them for Me and you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the disciples came to Jesus, saying, “Who then is greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus called a little child to Him, set him in the midst of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Assuredly, I say to you, unless you are converted and become as little children, you will by no means enter the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore whoever humbles himself as this little child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever receives one little child like this in My name receives Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in Me to sin, it would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were drowned in the depth of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to the world because of offenses! For offenses must come, but woe to that man by whom the offense comes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If your hand or foot causes you to sin, cut it off and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life lame or maimed, rather than having two hands or two feet, to be cast into the everlasting fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if your eye causes you to sin, pluck it out and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes, to be cast into hell fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take heed that you do not despise one of these little ones, for I say to you that in heaven their angels always see the face of My Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man has come to save that which was lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you think? If a man has a hundred sheep, and one of them goes astray, does he not leave the ninety-nine and go to the mountains to seek the one that is straying?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he should find it, assuredly, I say to you, he rejoices more over that sheep than over the ninety-nine that did not go astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones should perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moreover if your brother sins against you, go and tell him his fault between you and him alone. If he hears you, you have gained your brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he will not hear, take with you one or two more, that ‘by the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he refuses to hear them, tell it to the church. But if he refuses even to hear the church, let him be to you like a heathen and a tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Assuredly, I say to you, whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again I say to you that if two of you agree on earth concerning anything that they ask, it will be done for them by My Father in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where two or three are gathered together in My name, I am there in the midst of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter came to Him and said, “Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? Up to seven times?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “I do not say to you, up to seven times, but up to seventy times seven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the kingdom of heaven is like a certain king who wanted to settle accounts with his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had begun to settle accounts, one was brought to him who owed him ten thousand talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as he was not able to pay, his master commanded that he be sold, with his wife and children and all that he had, and that payment be made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant therefore fell down before him, saying, ‘Master, have patience with me, and I will pay you all.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the master of that servant was moved with compassion, released him, and forgave him the debt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But that servant went out and found one of his fellow servants who owed him a hundred denarii; and he laid hands on him and took him by the throat, saying, ‘Pay me what you owe!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So his fellow servant fell down at his feet and begged him, saying, ‘Have patience with me, and I will pay you all.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he would not, but went and threw him into prison till he should pay the debt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when his fellow servants saw what had been done, they were very grieved, and came and told their master all that had been done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his master, after he had called him, said to him, ‘You wicked servant! I forgave you all that debt because you begged me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should you not also have had compassion on your fellow servant, just as I had pity on you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his master was angry, and delivered him to the torturers until he should pay all that was due to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So My heavenly Father also will do to you if each of you, from his heart, does not forgive his brother his trespasses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass, when Jesus had finished these sayings, that He departed from Galilee and came to the region of Judea beyond the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And great multitudes followed Him, and He healed them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees also came to Him, testing Him, and saying to Him, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for just any reason?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He answered and said to them, “Have you not read that He who made them at the beginning ‘made them male and female,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, ‘For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife, and the two shall become one flesh’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, they are no longer two but one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, let not man separate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Why then did Moses command to give a certificate of divorce, and to put her away?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Moses, because of the hardness of your hearts, permitted you to divorce your wives, but from the beginning it was not so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I say to you, whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another, commits adultery; and whoever marries her who is divorced commits adultery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said to Him, “If such is the case of the man with his wife, it is better not to marry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said to them, “All cannot accept this saying, but only those to whom it has been given:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there are eunuchs who were born thus from their mother’s womb, and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men, and there are eunuchs who have made themselves eunuchs for the kingdom of heaven’s sake. He who is able to accept it, let him accept it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then little children were brought to Him that He might put His hands on them and pray, but the disciples rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Let the little children come to Me, and do not forbid them; for of such is the kingdom of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He laid His hands on them and departed from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now behold, one came and said to Him, “Good Teacher, what good thing shall I do that I may have eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one is good but One, that is, God. But if you want to enter into life, keep the commandments.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to Him, “Which ones?”
Jesus said, “‘You shall not murder,’ ‘You shall not commit adultery,’ ‘You shall not steal,’ ‘You shall not bear false witness,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young man said to Him, “All these things I have kept from my youth. What do I still lack?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “If you want to be perfect, go, sell what you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the young man heard that saying, he went away sorrowful, for he had great possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to His disciples, “Assuredly, I say to you that it is hard for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again I say to you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When His disciples heard it, they were greatly astonished, saying, “Who then can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus looked at them and said to them, “With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter answered and said to Him, “See, we have left all and followed You. Therefore what shall we have?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them, “Assuredly I say to you, that in the regeneration, when the Son of Man sits on the throne of His glory, you who have followed Me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or lands, for My name’s sake, shall receive a hundredfold, and inherit eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he had agreed with the laborers for a denarius a day, he sent them into his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went out about the third hour and saw others standing idle in the marketplace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and whatever is right I will give you.’ So they went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour, and did likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And about the eleventh hour he went out and found others standing idle, and said to them, ‘Why have you been standing here idle all day?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, ‘Because no one hired us.’ He said to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and whatever is right you will receive.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So when evening had come, the owner of the vineyard said to his steward, ‘Call the laborers and give them their wages, beginning with the last to the first.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when those came who were hired about the eleventh hour, they each received a denarius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the first came, they supposed that they would receive more; and they likewise received each a denarius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had received it, they complained against the landowner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘These last men have worked only one hour, and you made them equal to us who have borne the burden and the heat of the day.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered one of them and said, ‘Friend, I am doing you no wrong. Did you not agree with me for a denarius?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take what is yours and go your way. I wish to give to this last man the same as to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it not lawful for me to do what I wish with my own things? Or is your eye evil because I am good?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the last will be first, and the first last. For many are called, but few chosen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus, going up to Jerusalem, took the twelve disciples aside on the road and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be betrayed to the chief priests and to the scribes; and they will condemn Him to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and deliver Him to the Gentiles to mock and to scourge and to crucify. And the third day He will rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the mother of Zebedee’s sons came to Him with her sons, kneeling down and asking something from Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And He said to her, “What do you wish?”
She said to Him, “Grant that these two sons of mine may sit, one on Your right hand and the other on the left, in Your kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Jesus answered and said, “You do not know what you ask. Are you able to drink the cup that I am about to drink, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”
They said to Him, “We are able.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He said to them, “You will indeed drink My cup, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with; but to sit on My right hand and on My left is not Mine to give, but it is for those for whom it is prepared by My Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the ten heard it, they were greatly displeased with the two brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus called them to Himself and said, “You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and those who are great exercise authority over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet it shall not be so among you; but whoever desires to become great among you, let him be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever desires to be first among you, let him be your slave—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life a ransom for many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as they went out of Jericho, a great multitude followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, two blind men sitting by the road, when they heard that Jesus was passing by, cried out, saying, “Have mercy on us, O Lord, Son of David!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the multitude warned them that they should be quiet; but they cried out all the more, saying, “Have mercy on us, O Lord, Son of David!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus stood still and called them, and said, “What do you want Me to do for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Lord, that our eyes may be opened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus had compassion and touched their eyes. And immediately their eyes received sight, and they followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they drew near Jerusalem, and came to Bethphage, at the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to them, “Go into the village opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied, and a colt with her. Loose them and bring them to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if anyone says anything to you, you shall say, ‘The Lord has need of them,’ and immediately he will send them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All this was done that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Tell the daughter of Zion,
‘Behold, your King is coming to you,
Lowly, and sitting on a donkey,
A colt, the foal of a donkey.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples went and did as Jesus commanded them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the donkey and the colt, laid their clothes on them, and set Him on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a very great multitude spread their clothes on the road; others cut down branches from the trees and spread them on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the multitudes who went before and those who followed cried out, saying:
“Hosanna to the Son of David!
‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!’
Hosanna in the highest!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had come into Jerusalem, all the city was moved, saying, “Who is this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the multitudes said, “This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth of Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went into the temple of God and drove out all those who bought and sold in the temple, and overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those who sold doves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “It is written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a ‘den of thieves.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the blind and the lame came to Him in the temple, and He healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that He did, and the children crying out in the temple and saying, “Hosanna to the Son of David!” they were indignant
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and said to Him, “Do You hear what these are saying?”
And Jesus said to them, “Yes. Have you never read,
‘Out of the mouth of babes and nursing infants
You have perfected praise’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He left them and went out of the city to Bethany, and He lodged there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the morning, as He returned to the city, He was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seeing a fig tree by the road, He came to it and found nothing on it but leaves, and said to it, “Let no fruit grow on you ever again.” Immediately the fig tree withered away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the disciples saw it, they marveled, saying, “How did the fig tree wither away so soon?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus answered and said to them, “Assuredly, I say to you, if you have faith and do not doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but also if you say to this mountain, ‘Be removed and be cast into the sea,’ it will be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever things you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when He came into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people confronted Him as He was teaching, and said, “By what authority are You doing these things? And who gave You this authority?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered and said to them, “I also will ask you one thing, which if you tell Me, I likewise will tell you by what authority I do these things:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The baptism of John—where was it from? From heaven or from men?”
And they reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say to us, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ we fear the multitude, for all count John as a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they answered Jesus and said, “We do not know.”
And He said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But what do you think? A man had two sons, and he came to the first and said, ‘Son, go, work today in my vineyard.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said, ‘I will not,’ but afterward he regretted it and went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came to the second and said likewise. And he answered and said, ‘I go, sir,’ but he did not go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Which of the two did the will of his father?”
They said to Him, “The first.”
Jesus said to them, “Assuredly, I say to you that tax collectors and harlots enter the kingdom of God before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him; but tax collectors and harlots believed him; and when you saw it, you did not afterward relent and believe him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear another parable: There was a certain landowner who planted a vineyard and set a hedge around it, dug a winepress in it and built a tower. And he leased it to vinedressers and went into a far country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when vintage-time drew near, he sent his servants to the vinedressers, that they might receive its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the vinedressers took his servants, beat one, killed one, and stoned another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he sent other servants, more than the first, and they did likewise to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then last of all he sent his son to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the vinedressers saw the son, they said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him and seize his inheritance.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took him and cast him out of the vineyard and killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those vinedressers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “He will destroy those wicked men miserably, and lease his vineyard to other vinedressers who will render to him the fruits in their seasons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to them, “Have you never read in the Scriptures:
‘The stone which the builders rejected
Has become the chief cornerstone.
This was the Lord’s doing,
And it is marvelous in our eyes’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore I say to you, the kingdom of God will be taken from you and given to a nation bearing the fruits of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever falls on this stone will be broken; but on whomever it falls, it will grind him to powder.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the chief priests and Pharisees heard His parables, they perceived that He was speaking of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they sought to lay hands on Him, they feared the multitudes, because they took Him for a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and spoke to them again by parables and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The kingdom of heaven is like a certain king who arranged a marriage for his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sent out his servants to call those who were invited to the wedding; and they were not willing to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, he sent out other servants, saying, ‘Tell those who are invited, “See, I have prepared my dinner; my oxen and fatted cattle are killed, and all things are ready. Come to the wedding.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they made light of it and went their ways, one to his own farm, another to his business.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the rest seized his servants, treated them spitefully, and killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the king heard about it, he was furious. And he sent out his armies, destroyed those murderers, and burned up their city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding is ready, but those who were invited were not worthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore go into the highways, and as many as you find, invite to the wedding.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So those servants went out into the highways and gathered together all whom they found, both bad and good. And the wedding hall was filled with guests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the king came in to see the guests, he saw a man there who did not have on a wedding garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to him, ‘Friend, how did you come in here without a wedding garment?’ And he was speechless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king said to the servants, ‘Bind him hand and foot, take him away, and cast him into outer darkness; there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For many are called, but few are chosen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees went and plotted how they might entangle Him in His talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sent to Him their disciples with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that You are true, and teach the way of God in truth; nor do You care about anyone, for You do not regard the person of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell us, therefore, what do You think? Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said, “Why do you test Me, you hypocrites?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Show Me the tax money.”
So they brought Him a denarius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “Whose image and inscription is this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said to Him, “Caesar’s.”
And He said to them, “Render therefore to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had heard these words, they marveled, and left Him and went their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same day the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Him and asked Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying: “Teacher, Moses said that if a man dies, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife and raise up offspring for his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were with us seven brothers. The first died after he had married, and having no offspring, left his wife to his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise the second also, and the third, even to the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Last of all the woman died also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, in the resurrection, whose wife of the seven will she be? For they all had her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them, “You are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures nor the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels of God in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But concerning the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what was spoken to you by God, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the multitudes heard this, they were astonished at His teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Pharisees heard that He had silenced the Sadducees, they gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of them, a lawyer, asked Him a question, testing Him, and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, which is the great commandment in the law?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “‘You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the first and great commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the second is like it: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On these two commandments hang all the Law and the Prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying, “What do you think about the Christ? Whose Son is He?”
They said to Him, “The Son of David.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “How then does David in the Spirit call Him ‘Lord,’ saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
“Sit at My right hand,
Till I make Your enemies Your footstool” ’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If David then calls Him ‘Lord,’ how is He his Son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one was able to answer Him a word, nor from that day on did anyone dare question Him anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus spoke to the multitudes and to His disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying: “The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses’ seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore whatever they tell you to observe, that observe and do, but do not do according to their works; for they say, and do not do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they bind heavy burdens, hard to bear, and lay them on men’s shoulders; but they themselves will not move them with one of their fingers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all their works they do to be seen by men. They make their phylacteries broad and enlarge the borders of their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They love the best places at feasts, the best seats in the synagogues,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: greetings in the marketplaces, and to be called by men, ‘Rabbi, Rabbi.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you, do not be called ‘Rabbi’; for One is your Teacher, the Christ, and you are all brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not call anyone on earth your father; for One is your Father, He who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do not be called teachers; for One is your Teacher, the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who is greatest among you shall be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you shut up the kingdom of heaven against men; for you neither go in yourselves, nor do you allow those who are entering to go in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers. Therefore you will receive greater condemnation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you travel land and sea to win one proselyte, and when he is won, you make him twice as much a son of hell as yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, blind guides, who say, ‘Whoever swears by the temple, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gold of the temple, he is obliged to perform it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fools and blind! For which is greater, the gold or the temple that sanctifies the gold?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, ‘Whoever swears by the altar, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gift that is on it, he is obliged to perform it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fools and blind! For which is greater, the gift or the altar that sanctifies the gift?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he who swears by the altar, swears by it and by all things on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who swears by the temple, swears by it and by Him who dwells in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he who swears by heaven, swears by the throne of God and by Him who sits on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin, and have neglected the weightier matters of the law: justice and mercy and faith. These you ought to have done, without leaving the others undone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blind guides, who strain out a gnat and swallow a camel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you cleanse the outside of the cup and dish, but inside they are full of extortion and self-indulgence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blind Pharisee, first cleanse the inside of the cup and dish, that the outside of them may be clean also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like whitewashed tombs which indeed appear beautiful outwardly, but inside are full of dead men’s bones and all uncleanness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so you also outwardly appear righteous to men, but inside you are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you build the tombs of the prophets and adorn the monuments of the righteous,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore you are witnesses against yourselves that you are sons of those who murdered the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fill up, then, the measure of your fathers’ guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Serpents, brood of vipers! How can you escape the condemnation of hell?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, indeed, I send you prophets, wise men, and scribes: some of them you will kill and crucify, and some of them you will scourge in your synagogues and persecute from city to city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that on you may come all the righteous blood shed on the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah, son of Berechiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Assuredly, I say to you, all these things will come upon this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, the one who kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you were not willing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See! Your house is left to you desolate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I say to you, you shall see Me no more till you say, ‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went out and departed from the temple, and His disciples came up to show Him the buildings of the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “Do you not see all these things? Assuredly, I say to you, not one stone shall be left here upon another, that shall not be thrown down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as He sat on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to Him privately, saying, “Tell us, when will these things be? And what will be the sign of Your coming, and of the end of the age?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them: “Take heed that no one deceives you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and will deceive many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that you are not troubled; for all these things must come to pass, but the end is not yet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. And there will be famines, pestilences, and earthquakes in various places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these are the beginning of sorrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then they will deliver you up to tribulation and kill you, and you will be hated by all nations for My name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then many will be offended, will betray one another, and will hate one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then many false prophets will rise up and deceive many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because lawlessness will abound, the love of many will grow cold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who endures to the end shall be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in all the world as a witness to all the nations, and then the end will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore when you see the ‘abomination of desolation,’ spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place” (whoever reads, let him understand),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him who is on the housetop not go down to take anything out of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let him who is in the field not go back to get his clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing babies in those days!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And pray that your flight may not be in winter or on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For then there will be great tribulation, such as has not been since the beginning of the world until this time, no, nor ever shall be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And unless those days were shortened, no flesh would be saved; but for the elect’s sake those days will be shortened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or ‘There!’ do not believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For false christs and false prophets will rise and show great signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I have told you beforehand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore if they say to you, ‘Look, He is in the desert!’ do not go out; or ‘Look, He is in the inner rooms!’ do not believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the lightning comes from the east and flashes to the west, so also will the coming of the Son of Man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For wherever the carcass is, there the eagles will be gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Immediately after the tribulation of those days the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light; the stars will fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven, and then all the tribes of the earth will mourn, and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He will send His angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they will gather together His elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now learn this parable from the fig tree: When its branch has already become tender and puts forth leaves, you know that summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you also, when you see all these things, know that it is near—at the doors!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Assuredly, I say to you, this generation will by no means pass away till all these things take place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will by no means pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But of that day and hour no one knows, not even the angels of heaven, but My Father only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as the days of Noah were, so also will the coming of the Son of Man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as in the days before the flood, they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noah entered the ark,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and did not know until the flood came and took them all away, so also will the coming of the Son of Man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then two men will be in the field: one will be taken and the other left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two women will be grinding at the mill: one will be taken and the other left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch therefore, for you do not know what hour your Lord is coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But know this, that if the master of the house had known what hour the thief would come, he would have watched and not allowed his house to be broken into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you also be ready, for the Son of Man is coming at an hour you do not expect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who then is a faithful and wise servant, whom his master made ruler over his household, to give them food in due season?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is that servant whom his master, when he comes, will find so doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Assuredly, I say to you that he will make him ruler over all his goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that evil servant says in his heart, ‘My master is delaying his coming,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and begins to beat his fellow servants, and to eat and drink with the drunkards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the master of that servant will come on a day when he is not looking for him and at an hour that he is not aware of,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will cut him in two and appoint him his portion with the hypocrites. There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the kingdom of heaven shall be likened to ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now five of them were wise, and five were foolish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were foolish took their lamps and took no oil with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while the bridegroom was delayed, they all slumbered and slept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And at midnight a cry was heard: ‘Behold, the bridegroom is coming; go out to meet him!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all those virgins arose and trimmed their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the foolish said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil, for our lamps are going out.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the wise answered, saying, ‘No, lest there should not be enough for us and you; but go rather to those who sell, and buy for yourselves.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they went to buy, the bridegroom came, and those who were ready went in with him to the wedding; and the door was shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Afterward the other virgins came also, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open to us!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said, ‘Assuredly, I say to you, I do not know you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Watch therefore, for you know neither the day nor the hour in which the Son of Man is coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the kingdom of heaven is like a man traveling to a far country, who called his own servants and delivered his goods to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one, to each according to his own ability; and immediately he went on a journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he who had received the five talents went and traded with them, and made another five talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And likewise he who had received two gained two more also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who had received one went and dug in the ground, and hid his lord’s money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After a long time the lord of those servants came and settled accounts with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So he who had received five talents came and brought five other talents, saying, ‘Lord, you delivered to me five talents; look, I have gained five more talents besides them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant; you were faithful over a few things, I will make you ruler over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also who had received two talents came and said, ‘Lord, you delivered to me two talents; look, I have gained two more talents besides them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant; you have been faithful over a few things, I will make you ruler over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then he who had received the one talent came and said, ‘Lord, I knew you to be a hard man, reaping where you have not sown, and gathering where you have not scattered seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I was afraid, and went and hid your talent in the ground. Look, there you have what is yours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But his lord answered and said to him, ‘You wicked and lazy servant, you knew that I reap where I have not sown, and gather where I have not scattered seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you ought to have deposited my money with the bankers, and at my coming I would have received back my own with interest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So take the talent from him, and give it to him who has ten talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘For to everyone who has, more will be given, and he will have abundance; but from him who does not have, even what he has will be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And cast the unprofitable servant into the outer darkness. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Son of Man comes in His glory, and all the holy angels with Him, then He will sit on the throne of His glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the nations will be gathered before Him, and He will separate them one from another, as a shepherd divides his sheep from the goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He will set the sheep on His right hand, but the goats on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the King will say to those on His right hand, ‘Come, you blessed of My Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I was hungry and you gave Me food; I was thirsty and you gave Me drink; I was a stranger and you took Me in;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was naked and you clothed Me; I was sick and you visited Me; I was in prison and you came to Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the righteous will answer Him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry and feed You, or thirsty and give You drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When did we see You a stranger and take You in, or naked and clothe You?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or when did we see You sick, or in prison, and come to You?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the King will answer and say to them, ‘Assuredly, I say to you, inasmuch as you did it to one of the least of these My brethren, you did it to Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then He will also say to those on the left hand, ‘Depart from Me, you cursed, into the everlasting fire prepared for the devil and his angels:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I was hungry and you gave Me no food; I was thirsty and you gave Me no drink;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was a stranger and you did not take Me in, naked and you did not clothe Me, sick and in prison and you did not visit Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then they also will answer Him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison, and did not minister to You?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He will answer them, saying, ‘Assuredly, I say to you, inasmuch as you did not do it to one of the least of these, you did not do it to Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these will go away into everlasting punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, that He said to His disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You know that after two days is the Passover, and the Son of Man will be delivered up to be crucified.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders of the people assembled at the palace of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and plotted to take Jesus by trickery and kill Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “Not during the feast, lest there be an uproar among the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus was in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a woman came to Him having an alabaster flask of very costly fragrant oil, and she poured it on His head as He sat at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when His disciples saw it, they were indignant, saying, “Why this waste?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this fragrant oil might have been sold for much and given to the poor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus was aware of it, He said to them, “Why do you trouble the woman? For she has done a good work for Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have the poor with you always, but Me you do not have always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in pouring this fragrant oil on My body, she did it for My burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Assuredly, I say to you, wherever this gospel is preached in the whole world, what this woman has done will also be told as a memorial to her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “What are you willing to give me if I deliver Him to you?” And they counted out to him thirty pieces of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So from that time he sought opportunity to betray Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the first day of the Feast of the Unleavened Bread the disciples came to Jesus, saying to Him, “Where do You want us to prepare for You to eat the Passover?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said, “Go into the city to a certain man, and say to him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is at hand; I will keep the Passover at your house with My disciples.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples did as Jesus had directed them; and they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening had come, He sat down with the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as they were eating, He said, “Assuredly, I say to you, one of you will betray Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were exceedingly sorrowful, and each of them began to say to Him, “Lord, is it I?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said, “He who dipped his hand with Me in the dish will betray Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man indeed goes just as it is written of Him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been good for that man if he had not been born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Judas, who was betraying Him, answered and said, “Rabbi, is it I?”
He said to him, “You have said it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were eating, Jesus took bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to the disciples and said, “Take, eat; this is My body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He took the cup, and gave thanks, and gave it to them, saying, “Drink from it, all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is My blood of the new covenant, which is shed for many for the remission of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say to you, I will not drink of this fruit of the vine from now on until that day when I drink it new with you in My Father’s kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus said to them, “All of you will be made to stumble because of Me this night, for it is written:
‘I will strike the Shepherd,
And the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after I have been raised, I will go before you to Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter answered and said to Him, “Even if all are made to stumble because of You, I will never be made to stumble.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Assuredly, I say to you that this night, before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Peter said to Him, “Even if I have to die with You, I will not deny You!”
And so said all the disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane, and said to the disciples, “Sit here while I go and pray over there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He took with Him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and He began to be sorrowful and deeply distressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here and watch with Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went a little farther and fell on His face, and prayed, saying, “O My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass from Me; nevertheless, not as I will, but as You will.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He came to the disciples and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “What! Could you not watch with Me one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch and pray, lest you enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, a second time, He went away and prayed, saying, “O My Father, if this cup cannot pass away from Me unless I drink it, Your will be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He came and found them asleep again, for their eyes were heavy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He left them, went away again, and prayed the third time, saying the same words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He came to His disciples and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rise, let us be going. See, My betrayer is at hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while He was still speaking, behold, Judas, one of the twelve, with a great multitude with swords and clubs, came from the chief priests and elders of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now His betrayer had given them a sign, saying, “Whomever I kiss, He is the One; seize Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately he went up to Jesus and said, “Greetings, Rabbi!” and kissed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Jesus said to him, “Friend, why have you come?”
Then they came and laid hands on Jesus and took Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly, one of those who were with Jesus stretched out his hand and drew his sword, struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Put your sword in its place, for all who take the sword will perish by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or do you think that I cannot now pray to My Father, and He will provide Me with more than twelve legions of angels?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How then could the Scriptures be fulfilled, that it must happen thus?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that hour Jesus said to the multitudes, “Have you come out, as against a robber, with swords and clubs to take Me? I sat daily with you, teaching in the temple, and you did not seize Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But all this was done that the Scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled.”
Then all the disciples forsook Him and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who had laid hold of Jesus led Him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter followed Him at a distance to the high priest’s courtyard. And he went in and sat with the servants to see the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the chief priests, the elders, and all the council sought false testimony against Jesus to put Him to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but found none. Even though many false witnesses came forward, they found none. But at last two false witnesses came forward
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “This fellow said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and to build it in three days.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the high priest arose and said to Him, “Do You answer nothing? What is it these men testify against You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus kept silent. And the high priest answered and said to Him, “I put You under oath by the living God: Tell us if You are the Christ, the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “It is as you said. Nevertheless, I say to you, hereafter you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Power, and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest tore his clothes, saying, “He has spoken blasphemy! What further need do we have of witnesses? Look, now you have heard His blasphemy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What do you think?”
They answered and said, “He is deserving of death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they spat in His face and beat Him; and others struck Him with the palms of their hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Prophesy to us, Christ! Who is the one who struck You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter sat outside in the courtyard. And a servant girl came to him, saying, “You also were with Jesus of Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it before them all, saying, “I do not know what you are saying.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had gone out to the gateway, another girl saw him and said to those who were there, “This fellow also was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But again he denied with an oath, “I do not know the Man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a little later those who stood by came up and said to Peter, “Surely you also are one of them, for your speech betrays you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he began to curse and swear, saying, “I do not know the Man!”
Immediately a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter remembered the word of Jesus who had said to him, “Before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.” So he went out and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When morning came, all the chief priests and elders of the people plotted against Jesus to put Him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had bound Him, they led Him away and delivered Him to Pontius Pilate the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas, His betrayer, seeing that He had been condemned, was remorseful and brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying, “I have sinned by betraying innocent blood.”
And they said, “What is that to us? You see to it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he threw down the pieces of silver in the temple and departed, and went and hanged himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief priests took the silver pieces and said, “It is not lawful to put them into the treasury, because they are the price of blood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they consulted together and bought with them the potter’s field, to bury strangers in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore that field has been called the Field of Blood to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then was fulfilled what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet, saying, “And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the value of Him who was priced, whom they of the children of Israel priced,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and gave them for the potter’s field, as the Lord directed me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now Jesus stood before the governor. And the governor asked Him, saying, “Are You the King of the Jews?”
Jesus said to him, “It is as you say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while He was being accused by the chief priests and elders, He answered nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said to Him, “Do You not hear how many things they testify against You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He answered him not one word, so that the governor marveled greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the feast the governor was accustomed to releasing to the multitude one prisoner whom they wished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at that time they had a notorious prisoner called Barabbas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, when they had gathered together, Pilate said to them, “Whom do you want me to release to you? Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he knew that they had handed Him over because of envy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent to him, saying, “Have nothing to do with that just Man, for I have suffered many things today in a dream because of Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitudes that they should ask for Barabbas and destroy Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The governor answered and said to them, “Which of the two do you want me to release to you?”
They said, “Barabbas!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate said to them, “What then shall I do with Jesus who is called Christ?”
They all said to him, “Let Him be crucified!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the governor said, “Why, what evil has He done?”
But they cried out all the more, saying, “Let Him be crucified!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate saw that he could not prevail at all, but rather that a tumult was rising, he took water and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, “I am innocent of the blood of this just Person. You see to it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people answered and said, “His blood be on us and on our children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he released Barabbas to them; and when he had scourged Jesus, he delivered Him to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the Praetorium and gathered the whole garrison around Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they stripped Him and put a scarlet robe on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had twisted a crown of thorns, they put it on His head, and a reed in His right hand. And they bowed the knee before Him and mocked Him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they spat on Him, and took the reed and struck Him on the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had mocked Him, they took the robe off Him, put His own clothes on Him, and led Him away to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name. Him they compelled to bear His cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had come to a place called Golgotha, that is to say, Place of a Skull,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they gave Him sour wine mingled with gall to drink. But when He had tasted it, He would not drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they crucified Him, and divided His garments, casting lots, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet:
“They divided My garments among them,
And for My clothing they cast lots.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sitting down, they kept watch over Him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they put up over His head the accusation written against Him:
THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then two robbers were crucified with Him, one on the right and another on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who passed by blasphemed Him, wagging their heads
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “You who destroy the temple and build it in three days, save Yourself! If You are the Son of God, come down from the cross.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise the chief priests also, mocking with the scribes and elders, said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He saved others; Himself He cannot save. If He is the King of Israel, let Him now come down from the cross, and we will believe Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He trusted in God; let Him deliver Him now if He will have Him; for He said, ‘I am the Son of God.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even the robbers who were crucified with Him reviled Him with the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now from the sixth hour until the ninth hour there was darkness over all the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?” that is, “My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of those who stood there, when they heard that, said, “This Man is calling for Elijah!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately one of them ran and took a sponge, filled it with sour wine and put it on a reed, and offered it to Him to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest said, “Let Him alone; let us see if Elijah will come to save Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus cried out again with a loud voice, and yielded up His spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, behold, the veil of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom; and the earth quaked, and the rocks were split,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the graves were opened; and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and coming out of the graves after His resurrection, they went into the holy city and appeared to many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the centurion and those with him, who were guarding Jesus, saw the earthquake and the things that had happened, they feared greatly, saying, “Truly this was the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many women who followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering to Him, were there looking on from afar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: among whom were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when evening had come, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who himself had also become a disciple of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be given to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph had taken the body, he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and laid it in his new tomb which he had hewn out of the rock; and he rolled a large stone against the door of the tomb, and departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day, which followed the Day of Preparation, the chief priests and Pharisees gathered together to Pilate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Sir, we remember, while He was still alive, how that deceiver said, ‘After three days I will rise.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore command that the tomb be made secure until the third day, lest His disciples come by night and steal Him away, and say to the people, ‘He has risen from the dead.’ So the last deception will be worse than the first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to them, “You have a guard; go your way, make it as secure as you know how.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went and made the tomb secure, sealing the stone and setting the guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after the Sabbath, as the first day of the week began to dawn, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a great earthquake; for an angel of the Lord descended from heaven, and came and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His countenance was like lightning, and his clothing as white as snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the guards shook for fear of him, and became like dead men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel answered and said to the women, “Do not be afraid, for I know that you seek Jesus who was crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not here; for He is risen, as He said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And go quickly and tell His disciples that He is risen from the dead, and indeed He is going before you into Galilee; there you will see Him. Behold, I have told you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went out quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to bring His disciples word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they went to tell His disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, “Rejoice!” So they came and held Him by the feet and worshiped Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid. Go and tell My brethren to go to Galilee, and there they will see Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while they were going, behold, some of the guard came into the city and reported to the chief priests all the things that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had assembled with the elders and consulted together, they gave a large sum of money to the soldiers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Tell them, ‘His disciples came at night and stole Him away while we slept.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if this comes to the governor’s ears, we will appease him and make you secure.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took the money and did as they were instructed; and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee, to the mountain which Jesus had appointed for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw Him, they worshiped Him; but some doubted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus came and spoke to them, saying, “All authority has been given to Me in heaven and on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go therefore and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: teaching them to observe all things that I have commanded you; and lo, I am with you always, even to the end of the age.” Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
